description.p: Botanists are scholars of plants and their interactions with the world. Typically they specialize in a field of botany that captures their interest in the diverse world of plants.

ul.li: Equipment: Herbalism Kit, field notebook, 3 small clay pots, trowel, pouch with 10 gp, common clothes.

select.name: Specialization
select.item: Paleobotany - Study of biology and evolution of fossil plants.
Breeding - Study of plant heredity, selecting and crossing plants to develop desirable traits.
Ecology - Study of relationships between plants and the world they live in.
Agronomy - The study of crops and soil.
Pathology - Study of diseases of plants and their prevention.
Phytomancy - The study of magical plants and their applications.
Aquaculture - The study of aquatic and deep sea plants.
Forestry - The study of forest management to produce timber and promote conservation.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: A life of research has taught me to be persistent and never give up.
My time observing plants has informed me that patience is a virtue.
I am enthusiastic about my studies, often wanting to share them with everyone.
When I travel, I meticulously take note of the fauna around me.
I get bitter when people underestimate botanical studies.
I don’t mind getting my hands dirty because that’s often what gardening takes.
I love to be surrounded by the smells and sights of flora.
I often use botany as a lens to understand things that I would normally struggle with.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Noble Profession. I study plants and nature to solve problems like hunger (Good)
Preservation. Plants and forests must be preserved, life deserves its place (Good)
Knowledge. The pursuit of knowledge for life is beneficial to both me and others (Any)
Natural. Leaving the world to its natural state is the best course of action. (Neutral)
Greed. The plants I study exist to serve my purposes and I’ll take what I need to further my goals. (Evil)
Fascination. All plants make me wonder what medicines or technologies are possible with them. (Any)

select.name: Bond
select.item: I’m dearly attached to my plants, they are my children.
Destruction of forests or plants is an insult to me.
Industrialization destroyed the flora of my home and I will take revenge.
It is my duty to preserve the plants of the natural world.
A loved one is sick and the medicine they need has yet to be discovered, I will surely find the answer in plants.
My life’s work is my one true passion, everything I’ve studied has led to this.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I often put myself and others in danger to observe exotic plants.
I have a perfect memory of the plants I’ve studied, but not the names of people I meet.
I care more for the preservation of nature than other people.
I utilize illegal plant substances in my experiments.
Making new discoveries about plants is worth more than my life.
I fabricate results when a study doesn’t end in the way I wanted.

description.p: When you attempt to learn or recall botanical information, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a library, conservatory, scriptorium, university, or a sage or other learned person or creature. Additionally, you are likely to gain preferential treatment from most of these places (more so at a university/conservatory/etc) across the Realms, as professional courtesy shown to a fellow scholar. Your DM might rule that the knowledge you seek is secreted away in an almost inaccessible place, or that it simply cannot be found.
